title: >>> SUBJECT to CHANGE
body_text:
Subject to Change
I. The TOM FUND ...
... a special collections bin as a simple "thanks" for all that Luke has done in the past several months. However, not one penny was collected for the popular pizzaman as there was no bucket to put anything in. For whatever unknown reason, the bin was null and void at DODGEBALL 75.
II. Steve Adams's Surprise
What could he have up his sleeve you ask? It's a question without an answer as the charismatic showman decided to hold off one week before unvailing the must-see shocker. As pointed out in the DODGEBALL 75 preview, if Steve is involved in anyway, you can bet it'll be worth the wait. What could he possibly be hiding? DODGEBALL 76 may reveal the big secret.
III. Pick Your Poison
This was the big one as two of the sport's biggest icons met in their long awaited rematch for dodgeball surpremacy:
Chris Adams vs. Kevin Fitzpatrick 2
. To spruce up this mega-match, the all-new
Pick Your Poison
stipulation was added into the mix, allowing the captains to select their enemy's teams rather than their own.
But midday Saturday, shocking news broke right here on
dodgeball.livejournal.com
:
"Tonight's scheduled match between Chris Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick will be postponed. ... Thus, a suitable replacement has already been found and DODGEBALL 75's Pick Your Poison war will indeed take place ..."
It was an unfornate situation as megastar Kevin Fitzpatrick was forced out of his match with rival Chris Adams. Instead of "Can Chris tie-up the series?", the real question became "Who is Fitz's replacement?"
With the stars already in attendance, who could have possibly made a fair and suitable substitution for "Fitz"? It wasn't hard to find the man who would eventually challenge Chris in the first-ever
Pick Your Poison
confrontation; the returning Lenny Herrera.
For weeks and even months, players and spectators alike persistently asked of the catching machine's mysterious disappearance from a game he himself loved. All rumors were layed to rest as the multi-time award winner was back and ready to take on challenges set before him.
>> Pick Your Poison: Chris Adams vs. Lenny Herrera
Talk about a match to be remembered, look no further than this show-stealer. An all painball clash of warriors ...
The Toms River Tournament has had its effect on the dodgeball world as bulletballs were shoved aside yet again. For the second week running, painballs became the only weapons to use.
Team CHRIS made a statement. Though Team LENNY had acquired some incredible stars, their power and agility just wasn't enough in the early goings. The first five games were eanred the hard way for Chris Adams and company.
Things started to take a turn for the worse as Team CHRIS began to suffer a number of losses. By the three-hour mark, Lenny's "0" became a "2", and were ready and willing to pick up a few more victories before night's end. But it was just not meant to be.
Team CHRIS was able to fend off Team LENNY, winning 6 - 3. It was an outstanding match highlighted by all-around athelticism [and comedy] by Juan Londono, debuting powerhouse Mike Langley, and the continuing feud between Kevin Fitzpatrick (who would arrive late and join Team LENNY) and Chris Adams himself.
Match Summary: Games 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7 (Team CHRIS wins); Games 6, 8, 9 (Team LENNY wins)
-- Following the match, the "Hot Hands" catcher award winner spoke on his return event:
"Coming back to dodgeball was a real thrill ... since it would be following the weekend after the tournament. Although my attendance expectations were not met, I knew it would be a night to remember especially since this would be my first time playing a version of 'Dark Dodgeball'. Throw in a little bit of 'Prison ball' with only painballs and it's quite fun.
... I was a bit ... cold, but thanks to some of our caring friends, we quickly warmed up with some hot chocolate and pizza. It's amazing how much passion in dodgeball, drive people like us to come out at night, stand up to the cold, and be with friends playing an amazing sport."
- LENNY HERRERA
DODGEBALL 75 Records
> Attendance: 21
> Biggest Return: Lenny Herrera & Chris Rible (Last appareance at DODGEBALL LX)
> New Players: (1) Mike Langley
- The scheduled match between Chris Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick* did
not
occur as "Fitz" was unable to attend in the early goings. Instead, a returning Lenny Herrera served as the last minute replacement. After his victory, Chris Adams improved his captains standings to 4-3-0, having also tied the record for "Most Times Captain" with 7 along with John Tronolone and Sara DeCuir. Lenny's record currently stands at 3-2-1.
- DODGEBALL 75 witnessed the first-ever
Pick Your Poison
captains match which means the respective captains formed their opponent's team.
- Under
Prison Ball
rules, only painballs and a the Beeball were used throughout the event. This was only the second painball-only event following DODGEBALL 74.
- As already mentioned, Steve Adams is holding off on the big surprise until DODGEBALL 76. The
TOM FUND
will also debut at 76.
*A conflicting work schedule prevented "Fitz" from participating in the Pick Your Poison match-up.
DODGEBALL 76
Subject to change is right. Without any of the planned occurances going down at 75, prepare for the many extras at DODGEBALL 76.
DODGEBALL 76 is Saturday,
February 17
.
body_html:
Subject to Change
I. The TOM FUND ...
... a special collections bin as a simple "thanks" for all that Luke has done in the past several months. However, not one penny was collected for the popular pizzaman as there was no bucket to put anything in. For whatever unknown reason, the bin was null and void at DODGEBALL 75.

II. Steve Adams's Surprise
What could he have up his sleeve you ask? It's a question without an answer as the charismatic showman decided to hold off one week before unvailing the must-see shocker. As pointed out in the DODGEBALL 75 preview, if Steve is involved in anyway, you can bet it'll be worth the wait. What could he possibly be hiding? DODGEBALL 76 may reveal the big secret.

III. Pick Your Poison
This was the big one as two of the sport's biggest icons met in their long awaited rematch for dodgeball surpremacy: Chris Adams vs. Kevin Fitzpatrick 2. To spruce up this mega-match, the all-new Pick Your Poison stipulation was added into the mix, allowing the captains to select their enemy's teams rather than their own.

But midday Saturday, shocking news broke right here on dodgeball.livejournal.com :
"Tonight's scheduled match between Chris Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick will be postponed. ... Thus, a suitable replacement has already been found and DODGEBALL 75's Pick Your Poison war will indeed take place ..."

It was an unfornate situation as megastar Kevin Fitzpatrick was forced out of his match with rival Chris Adams. Instead of "Can Chris tie-up the series?", the real question became "Who is Fitz's replacement?"

With the stars already in attendance, who could have possibly made a fair and suitable substitution for "Fitz"? It wasn't hard to find the man who would eventually challenge Chris in the first-ever Pick Your Poison confrontation; the returning Lenny Herrera.

For weeks and even months, players and spectators alike persistently asked of the catching machine's mysterious disappearance from a game he himself loved. All rumors were layed to rest as the multi-time award winner was back and ready to take on challenges set before him.

>> Pick Your Poison: Chris Adams vs. Lenny Herrera
Talk about a match to be remembered, look no further than this show-stealer. An all painball clash of warriors ...

The Toms River Tournament has had its effect on the dodgeball world as bulletballs were shoved aside yet again. For the second week running, painballs became the only weapons to use.

Team CHRIS made a statement. Though Team LENNY had acquired some incredible stars, their power and agility just wasn't enough in the early goings. The first five games were eanred the hard way for Chris Adams and company.

Things started to take a turn for the worse as Team CHRIS began to suffer a number of losses. By the three-hour mark, Lenny's "0" became a "2", and were ready and willing to pick up a few more victories before night's end. But it was just not meant to be.

Team CHRIS was able to fend off Team LENNY, winning 6 - 3. It was an outstanding match highlighted by all-around athelticism [and comedy] by Juan Londono, debuting powerhouse Mike Langley, and the continuing feud between Kevin Fitzpatrick (who would arrive late and join Team LENNY) and Chris Adams himself.

Match Summary: Games 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7 (Team CHRIS wins); Games 6, 8, 9 (Team LENNY wins)

-- Following the match, the "Hot Hands" catcher award winner spoke on his return event:
"Coming back to dodgeball was a real thrill ... since it would be following the weekend after the tournament. Although my attendance expectations were not met, I knew it would be a night to remember especially since this would be my first time playing a version of 'Dark Dodgeball'. Throw in a little bit of 'Prison ball' with only painballs and it's quite fun.

... I was a bit ... cold, but thanks to some of our caring friends, we quickly warmed up with some hot chocolate and pizza. It's amazing how much passion in dodgeball, drive people like us to come out at night, stand up to the cold, and be with friends playing an amazing sport."
- LENNY HERRERA

DODGEBALL 75 Records
> Attendance: 21
> Biggest Return: Lenny Herrera & Chris Rible (Last appareance at DODGEBALL LX)
> New Players: (1) Mike Langley

- The scheduled match between Chris Adams and Kevin Fitzpatrick* did not occur as "Fitz" was unable to attend in the early goings. Instead, a returning Lenny Herrera served as the last minute replacement. After his victory, Chris Adams improved his captains standings to 4-3-0, having also tied the record for "Most Times Captain" with 7 along with John Tronolone and Sara DeCuir. Lenny's record currently stands at 3-2-1.
- DODGEBALL 75 witnessed the first-ever Pick Your Poison captains match which means the respective captains formed their opponent's team.
- Under Prison Ball rules, only painballs and a the Beeball were used throughout the event. This was only the second painball-only event following DODGEBALL 74.
- As already mentioned, Steve Adams is holding off on the big surprise until DODGEBALL 76. The TOM FUND will also debut at 76.

*A conflicting work schedule prevented "Fitz" from participating in the Pick Your Poison match-up.

DODGEBALL 76
Subject to change is right. Without any of the planned occurances going down at 75, prepare for the many extras at DODGEBALL 76.

DODGEBALL 76 is Saturday, February 17.
